description.narrative: Behaviour and social change of the target communities on key priorities increased through Communication for Development, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Environmental Sustainability, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Well-coordinated and result-based planning, M&E, Communication, Advocacy and Partnership are in place to enhance the Rwanda Country Programme effectiveness and efficiency

sector.narrative: Capacity and skills development for social behaviour change
Innovation, multi-media content production and dissemination

title.narrative: Rwanda United Nations Development Assistance Framework 2018 to 2023
UNICEF Programmes in Rwanda (Humanitarian action and Emergencies)
Description of UNICEF programming approach framework at the country level with Common Country Assessments (CCAs) providing the equivalence of pre project appraisals
Interagency Humanitarian Response Assessments and Plans
UN Sustainable Development Group Database of Common Country Analyses
UNINFO Document Database to search for Common Country Analysis and Cooperation Framework
UNICEF Policy on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF Procedure on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF procedure for programme implementation partnerships
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Rwanda 2021 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Behaviour and social change of the target communities on key priorities increased through Communication for Development

description.narrative: Estimated 7.9 million people reached through social mobilisation with religious leaders, community theatre and media coverage. ECD evaluation showed: significant declines in diarrhoea prevalence from 29% at baseline to 16% at endline; and 20% less parents thinking physical punishment is necessary in the intervention site than in the control site | Status:Met | As-of Date:03/10/2018

title.narrative: of target population reached with key behaviour change messages to prevent stunting

actual.value: 2018:On track. Assessment report of the 1,000 days' campaign found 69% reach, or estimated 7.9 million people (achieved).

title.narrative: % of children 24-35 months old exposed to any violent discipline in the 10 ECD intervention sites

actual.value: 2018:The percentage of older children exposed to any violent discipline at end line was 91.4% in the control site and 84.7% in the intervention site where ECD centre operated for over a year. (not achieved). However, proportion of parents who think physical punishment is necessary is 20% less in the inte
